intro: Gentiana officinalis, commonly known as the gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its root system is fibrous and contains alkaloids, which contribute to its medicinal properties. Gentiana officinalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
